intro: Jasione pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Pyrenees mountain range. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It has basal leaves that are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs. Jasione pyrenaica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
